cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau and 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest through the north-western Bahamas today, then paralleling the Florida east coast Friday and racing north-northwestward toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline Saturday before turning eastward offshore
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: skirting the Georgia coast near St. Simons/Brunswick (center may remain just offshore)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch – north of the Brunswick area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC, including the entire Georgia coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (74%) of tropical-storm-force winds and up to 36% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible as the core brushes the coast Friday night–Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 6–9 ft above ground possible along the Georgia coast, including the Brunswick river entrance, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches possible, producing flash-flood risk in coastal southeast Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, large breaking waves, and life-threatening rip currents; possible coastal road overwash and minor structural damage in low-lying port facilities.
